00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethod.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Tue Jan 17 21:32:26 2006
00026  *
00027  * @brief  Abstract interface for a quantification method.
00028  */
00029 
00030 #ifndef _QUANTMETHOD_H_
00031 #define _QUANTMETHOD_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 //#include <ctime>
00035 #include "chipstream/AnalysisInfo.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/ChipStream.h"
00037 #include "chipstream/IntensityMart.h"
00038 #include "chipstream/PmAdjuster.h"
00039 #include "chipstream/PmOnlyAdjust.h"
00040 #include "chipstream/ProbeSet.h"
00041 #include "chipstream/PsBoard.h"
00042 //
00043 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00044 
00045 //
00046 #include <cstring>
00047 #include <string>
00048 #include <vector>

00050 
00051 /**
00052  *  QuantMethod - Interface for computing quantification summaries from PM intensities
00053  * grouped into probe set groups.
00054  * 
00055  */
00056 class QuantMethod : public SelfDoc, public SelfCreate {
00057 
00058 public:
00059 
00060   /** Different scales that the summary results can be in. */
00061   enum Scale {
00062     Linear,   ///< Same scale as cel file, like plier results.
00063     Log2,     ///< Log base 2 scale, like rma results.
00064     Pvalue,   ///< Scale is p-value (between 0 and 1 inclusive)
00065     NegLog10  ///< Scale is -1 * log_10(value), useful for uncompressing p-values
00066   };
00067 
00068   /** 
00069    * Convert a Scale enumeration to a text description. 
00070    * @param s - Enumerated value.
00071    * @return - String version of enumeration value.
00072    */
00073   static std::string scaleToTxt(enum Scale s);
00074 
00075   /** Different types of expression quantification methods. */
00076   enum QuantType {
00077     Summarize, ///< Produces a summarized intensity estimate like rma or plier.
00078     Detection, ///< Produces a absent/present call and confidence
00079     GenoCall   ///< Produces a genotyping call.
00080   };
00081 
00082   /** 
00083    * Convert a QuantType enumeration to a human readable string representation.
00084    * @param q - QuantType to convert.
00085    * @return - Text version of QuantType enumeration.
00086    */
00087   static std::string quantTypeToTxt(enum QuantType q);
00088 
00089  /** 
00090    * @brief Virtual destructor for a virtual class.
00091    */
00092   virtual ~QuantMethod();
00093 
00094   /** 
00095    * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00096    * set, chip layout and data.
00097    * 
00098    * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00099    * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00100    * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00101    * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00102    * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00103    */
00104   virtual bool setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart,
00105                      std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) = 0;
00106 
00107   /** 
00108    * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00109    * set, chip layout and data. Avoids issues of transformations and
00110    * adjustments for a more streamlined approach.
00111    * 
00112    * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00113    * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00114    * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00115    */
00116   virtual bool setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00117 
00118   /** 
00119    * @brief Do the heavy lifting of estimation.
00120    */
00121   virtual void computeEstimate() = 0;
00122 
00123   /** 
00124    * @brief Transform raw data for probe index on chip and chip index using the
00125    * chip stream intensity transformers.
00126    * 
00127    * @param probeIx - Probe index on chip.
00128    * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00129    * @param iMart - Raw data. 
00130    * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data.
00131    * 
00132    * @return 
00133    */
00134   static float transformPrimaryData(probeid_t probeIx, 
00135                                     chipid_t chipIx, 
00136                                     const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00137                                     std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00138                                     unsigned int channelIx = 0);
00139 
00140   /** 
00141    * @brief Returns PM minus attenuated mismatch value so such that the return value is 
00142    * greater than or equal to zero. In short, we return (x+sqrt(x^2+H))/2 where 
00143    * H = 4*pM*MM*L and X = PM-MM. This is in effect generalized log without the log
00144    * transformation.
00145    * 
00146    * @param pmI - perfect match intensity
00147    * @param mmI - mismatch intensity
00148    * @param l - optional tunable parameter, default is 0.005 must be between 0 and 1 inclusive
00149    * @param h - optional parameter, allows one to override computation of H from
00150    * data. If less than zero computed from data as 4*PM*MM*l
00151    * 
00152    * @return 
00153    */
00154   static float attenuateIntensity(float pmI, float mmI, float l=0.005, float h=-1);
00155 
00156   /** 
00157    * @brief What is the name of the quantification method?
00158    * @return name of adjuster.
00159    */  
00160   virtual std::string getType() = 0;
00161   
00162   /** 
00163    * What version of the expression algorithm are we implementing?
00164    * @return version string. something like "1.0" but different versions
00165    * must be implemented in derive algorithm classes
00166    */
00167   virtual std::string getVersion() = 0;
00168 
00169   /** 
00170    * What scale are the target effects on? Are they linear (like
00171    * plier) or log2 (like rma)
00172    * @return - What scale are the results provided in?
00173    */
00174   virtual enum Scale getScale();
00175 
00176   /** 
00177    * What type of quantification method is this? Summarization like
00178    * plier detection like dabg.
00179    * @return - Type of quantification method.
00180    */
00181   virtual enum QuantType getQuantType();
00182 
00183   /** 
00184    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00185    * streams and print headers to files etc.
00186    * 
00187    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00188    * @param iMart  - intensity holder
00189    * 
00190    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00191    */
00192   virtual bool prepare(const IntensityMart &iMart);
00193 
00194   /** 
00195    * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00196    * results and clean up.
00197    * 
00198    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00199    */
00200   virtual bool finish();
00201 
00202   /**
00203    * Custom configuration for this QuantMethod
00204    */
00205   virtual void setParameters(PsBoard &board) {
00206     Err::errAbort("setParameters() is not supported in class: " + getDocName());
00207   }
00208 
00209   void setAnalysisInfo(AnalysisInfo &info) {
00210     m_Info = info;
00211   }
00212 
00213 protected:
00214   AnalysisInfo m_Info;
00215 
00216 };
00217 
00218 #endif /* _QUANTMETHOD_H_ */
